lwdid
  • API Reference
  • LWDIDResults Class
  • View page source

215- ri_pvalue: Randomization inference p-value (if ri=True) 216- ri_method: Randomization inference method ('permutation' or 'bootstrap') 217- rireps: Total number of RI replications requested 218- ri_valid: Number of successful RI replications 219- ri_failed: Number of failed RI replications 220- ri_seed: Random seed used for RI (if provided)

79 # Randomization inference summary (no full distribution stored) 80 print(f”RI p-value: {results.ri_pvalue:.4f}”) 81 print(f”RI method: {results.ri_method}”) 82 print(f”Valid replications: {results.ri_valid}/{results.rireps}”) 74 results = lwdid( 75 data, ‘y’, ‘d’, ‘unit’, ‘year’, ‘post’, ‘demean’, 76 ri=True, rireps=1000, seed=42 77 ) 78Results Module (results) ========================

The results module provides the LWDIDResults class, which stores and presents estimation results from the lwdid() function.

LWDIDResults Class

class lwdid.LWDIDResults(results_dict, metadata, att_by_period=None)[source]

Bases: object

Container for lwdid estimation results

This class stores all estimation outputs from the lwdid() function and provides methods for displaying, visualizing, and exporting results. All core attributes are read-only properties to ensure result integrity.

att

Average treatment effect on the treated (ATT) point estimate.

Type:

float

se_att

Standard error of ATT.

Type:

float

t_stat

t-statistic for H0: ATT = 0.

Type:

float

pvalue

Two-sided p-value for t-test.

Type:

float

ci_lower, ci_upper

Lower and upper bounds of 95% confidence interval.

Type:

float

nobs

Number of observations in the regression.

Type:

int

n_treated, n_control

Number of treated and control units.

Type:

int

K

Last pre-treatment period index.

Type:

int

tpost1

First post-treatment period index.

Type:

int

df_resid

Residual degrees of freedom from the main regression.

Type:

int

df_inference

Degrees of freedom used for inference. For cluster-robust standard errors, this is G - 1 (number of clusters minus 1). For other variance estimators, this equals df_resid. This is the df value displayed in summary() and used for computing t-statistics and confidence intervals.

Type:

int

rolling

Transformation method used (‘demean’, ‘detrend’, ‘demeanq’, or ‘detrendq’).

Type:

str

vce_type

Variance estimator type (‘ols’, ‘robust’, ‘hc1’, ‘hc3’, or ‘cluster’).

Type:

str

cluster_var

Clustering variable name (if vce=’cluster’).

Type:

str or None

n_clusters

Number of clusters (if vce=’cluster’).

Type:

int or None

controls_used

Whether control variables were included.

Type:

bool

controls

List of control variable names used.

Type:

list

params

Full vector of regression coefficients.

Type:

array-like

bse

Standard errors of all coefficients.

Type:

array-like

vcov

Variance-covariance matrix.

Type:

array-like

att_by_period

Period-specific ATT estimates with columns: period, tindex, beta, se, ci_lower, ci_upper, tstat, pval, N.

Type:

pd.DataFrame

ri_pvalue

Randomization inference p-value (if ri=True was specified).

Type:

float or None

ri_seed

Random seed used for RI.

Type:

int or None

rireps

Number of RI permutations.

Type:

int or None

ri_method

Randomization inference method used (‘bootstrap’ or ‘permutation’). Only available if ri=True was specified.

Type:

str or None

ri_valid

Number of valid (successful) RI replications. Only available if ri=True.

Type:

int or None

ri_failed

Number of failed RI replications. Only available if ri=True.

Type:

int or None

data

Transformed data used for regression (internal attribute, not a public property). Contains the rolling-transformed outcome variable and other regression variables. If the original ivar was string type, this DataFrame contains numeric IDs (1, 2, 3, …). The mapping between original and numeric IDs is stored in data.attrs[‘id_mapping’].

Access via: results.data (not recommended for typical use)

String ID mapping (if applicable):

  • results.data.attrs[‘id_mapping’][‘original_to_numeric’]: dict mapping original IDs to numeric

  • results.data.attrs[‘id_mapping’][‘numeric_to_original’]: dict mapping numeric to original IDs

Example:

If ivar=’state’ with values [‘CA’, ‘TX’, ‘NY’], they are encoded as 1, 2, 3. results.data.attrs[‘id_mapping’] = {

‘original_to_numeric’: {‘CA’: 1, ‘TX’: 2, ‘NY’: 3}, ‘numeric_to_original’: {1: ‘CA’, 2: ‘TX’, 3: ‘NY’}

}

Type:

pd.DataFrame

summary() : str

Returns formatted results summary string.

plot(gid=None, graph_options=None) : matplotlib.Figure

Generates plot of residualized outcomes (control vs. treated).

to_excel(path) : None

Exports results to Excel file with multiple sheets.

to_csv(path) : None

Exports period-specific effects to CSV.

to_latex(path) : None

Exports results to LaTeX table format.

Examples

>>> from lwdid import lwdid
>>> import pandas as pd
>>> data = pd.read_csv('smoking.csv')
>>> results = lwdid(data, y='lcigsale', d='treated', ivar='state',
...                 tvar='year', post='post', rolling='demean')
>>>
>>> # View summary
>>> print(results.summary())
>>>
>>> # Access attributes
>>> print(f"ATT: {results.att:.4f}")
>>> print(f"SE: {results.se_att:.4f}")
>>> print(f"p-value: {results.pvalue:.3f}")
>>>
>>> # Period-specific effects
>>> print(results.att_by_period)
>>>
>>> # Visualization
>>> fig = results.plot()
>>> fig.savefig('did_plot.png')
>>>
>>> # Export
>>> results.to_excel('results.xlsx')
__init__(results_dict, metadata, att_by_period=None)[source]

Initialize results object

Parameters:

results_dict: Results from estimate_att() metadata: Metadata from validate_and_prepare_data() att_by_period: Period-specific effects (optional)

property att: float

ATT estimate

property se_att: float

Standard error

property t_stat: float

t-statistic

property pvalue: float

p-value

property ci_lower: float

95% CI lower bound

property ci_upper: float

95% CI upper bound

property nobs: int

Number of observations

property n_treated: int

Number of treated units

property n_control: int

Number of control units

property df_resid: int

Residual degrees of freedom

property df_inference: int

Degrees of freedom for inference (G-1 for cluster, df_resid otherwise)

property K: int

Last pre-treatment period

property tpost1: int

First post-treatment period

property cmd: str

Command name

property depvar: str

Dependent variable

property rolling: str

Transformation method

property vce_type: str | None

Variance estimator

property cluster_var: str | None

Clustering variable

property n_clusters: int | None

Number of clusters

property controls_used: bool

Controls included

property controls: list

Control variables

property params

Coefficient vector

property bse

Standard errors

property vcov

Variance-covariance matrix

property att_by_period: DataFrame | None

Period-specific effects (returns copy)

property ri_pvalue: float | None

RI p-value

property ri_seed: int | None

RI seed

property rireps: int | None

RI replications

property ri_method: str | None

RI method

property ri_valid: int | None

Valid RI replications

property ri_failed: int | None

Failed RI replications

property data: DataFrame | None

Transformed data

summary()[source]

Formatted results summary

Return type:

str

property metadata: Dict[str, Any]
plot(gid=None, graph_options=None)[source]
to_excel(path)[source]
to_csv(path)[source]
to_latex(path)[source]

Examples

Accessing Core Estimates

from lwdid import lwdid

results = lwdid(data, 'outcome', 'd', 'unit', 'year', 'post', 'demean')

# Point estimate and inference
print(f"ATT: {results.att:.4f}")
print(f"Standard Error: {results.se_att:.4f}")
print(f"t-statistic: {results.t_stat:.4f}")
print(f"p-value: {results.pvalue:.4f}")
print(f"95% CI: [{results.ci_lower:.4f}, {results.ci_upper:.4f}]")
print(f"Degrees of freedom: {results.df_inference}")

Sample Information

# Sample composition
print(f"Total observations: {results.nobs}")
print(f"Treated units: {results.n_treated}")
print(f"Control units: {results.n_control}")
print(f"Pre-treatment periods: {results.K}")
print(f"First post-treatment period: {results.tpost1}")

Period-Specific Effects

# Access period-by-period estimates
period_effects = results.att_by_period

# DataFrame with columns:
# period, tindex, beta, se, ci_lower, ci_upper, tstat, pval, N
print(period_effects)

# Filter to specific periods
post_2000 = period_effects[period_effects['period'] >= 2000]

# Check for pre-treatment effects (parallel trends test)
pre_treatment = period_effects[period_effects['tindex'] < results.tpost1]
significant_pre = pre_treatment[pre_treatment['pval'] < 0.05]
if len(significant_pre) > 0:
    print("Warning: Significant pre-treatment effects detected")

Randomization Inference Results

results = lwdid(data, 'y', 'd', 'unit', 'year', 'post', 'demean',
                ri=True, rireps=1000, seed=42)

# RI p-value
print(f"RI p-value: {results.ri_pvalue:.4f}")
print(f"RI method: {results.ri_method}")
print(f"Valid replications: {results.ri_valid}/{results.rireps}")
print(f"Failed replications: {results.ri_failed}")
print(f"Random seed: {results.ri_seed}")

Printing Summary

# Print formatted summary to console
results.summary()

# Or capture as string
summary_text = str(results)

Visualization

# Basic plot
results.plot()

# Customized plot
results.plot(
    figsize=(12, 6),
    title='Treatment Effects Over Time',
    ylabel='Log Cigarette Sales',
    xlabel='Year'
)

Exporting Results

Excel Export:

# Export to Excel with multiple sheets
results.to_excel('results.xlsx')

# This creates:
# - Summary sheet: Main ATT estimate and sample info
# - ByPeriod sheet: Period-specific estimates
# - RI sheet: Randomization inference results (if ri=True)

CSV Export:

# Export period-specific estimates to CSV
results.to_csv('period_effects.csv')

LaTeX Export:

# Export publication-ready LaTeX table
results.to_latex('table.tex')

# Include in your LaTeX document:
# \input{table.tex}

Working with Results Programmatically

# Extract specific information
att_estimate = results.att
standard_error = results.se_att

# Construct custom confidence interval (e.g., 90%)
from scipy import stats
alpha = 0.10
t_crit = stats.t.ppf(1 - alpha/2, results.df_inference)
ci_90_lower = results.att - t_crit * results.se_att
ci_90_upper = results.att + t_crit * results.se_att
print(f"90% CI: [{ci_90_lower:.4f}, {ci_90_upper:.4f}]")

# Combine results from multiple specifications
specs = []
for rolling in ['demean', 'detrend']:
    for vce in [None, 'hc3']:
        res = lwdid(data, 'y', 'd', 'unit', 'year', 'post', rolling, vce=vce)
        specs.append({
            'rolling': rolling,
            'vce': vce or 'ols',
            'att': res.att,
            'se': res.se_att,
            'pvalue': res.pvalue
        })

import pandas as pd
comparison = pd.DataFrame(specs)
print(comparison)

Attributes Reference

Core Estimates

  • att: Average treatment effect on the treated

  • se_att: Standard error of ATT

  • t_stat: t-statistic for testing H₀: ATT = 0

  • pvalue: Two-sided p-value

  • ci_lower: Lower bound of 95% confidence interval

  • ci_upper: Upper bound of 95% confidence interval

  • df_inference: Degrees of freedom for t-based inference

Sample Information

  • nobs: Number of observations in the regression

  • n_treated: Number of treated units

  • n_control: Number of control units

  • K: Number of pre-treatment periods

  • tpost1: First post-treatment period index

Period-Specific Results

  • att_by_period: DataFrame with period-specific treatment effects

Randomization Inference

  • ri_pvalue: Randomization inference p-value (if ri=True)

  • ri_method: Method used (‘permutation’ or ‘bootstrap’)

  • rireps: Total number of RI replications requested

  • ri_valid: Number of successful RI replications

  • ri_failed: Number of failed RI replications

  • ri_seed: Random seed used for RI (if provided)

Methods Reference

  • summary(): Print formatted summary of results

  • plot(): Visualize treatment effects over time

  • to_excel(path): Export results to Excel file

  • to_csv(path): Export period-specific effects to CSV

  • to_latex(path): Export results to LaTeX table

See Also

  • lwdid.lwdid() - Main estimation function

  • Quick Start - Quick start tutorial
